\setlength{\rightmargin}{\leftmargin}

\raggedright
\setlength{\itemsep}{0pt}
\setlength{\parsep}{0pt}
\normalfont\ttfamily}%

{\end{list}}

\colorlet{myboxcolor}{red!50!black}

\usepackage{colortbl}

\makeatother

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}




\tcbset{colframe=myboxcolor, fonttitle=\Large\bfseries, boxsep=5mm}

\noindent \tcbox[colback=myboxcolor, coltext=white]{\noindent 



\noindent %
\begin{tabular}{>{\raggedright}p{0.19\linewidth}>{\centering}p{0.581\linewidth}>{\raggedleft}p{0.19\linewidth}}
\multirow{2}{0.19\linewidth}{{[}Logo?{]}} & \textbf{{\VERYHuge{}\textbf{Poster Heading}}} & \multirow{2}{0.19\linewidth}{\centering{}~\hfill{}{[}Logo?{]}}\tabularnewline
 & \noindent {\veryHuge{}\noindent Sub-Heading} & \tabularnewline
\end{tabular}}

\begin{lyxcode}
\vspace*{-42pt}
\begin{minipage}[t]{0.49\columnwidth}%
\begin{tcolorbox}
Left text

with several paragraphs

with several paragraphs
\end{tcolorbox}
%
\end{minipage} %
\begin{minipage}[t]{0.49\columnwidth}%
\begin{tcolorbox}
Right text

with several paragraphs

with several paragraphs
\end{tcolorbox}
%
\end{minipage}
\end{lyxcode}


\begin{tcolorbox}[title=Multiple Columns with the ``Multiple Columns'' Module]


\setlength{\columnsep}{2.2cm}

\begin{multicols}{4}


Wide blocks on a poster usually have too long lines (more than 60
letters per line is difficult to read).

One way to solve this is using columns. To this end, you can use the
``Multiple Columns'' module, as done here. It provides the ``Columns''
inset this text is written in. The space between the columns can be
adjusted via the \LaTeX{} code \texttt{\textbackslash{}setlength\{\textbackslash{}columnsep\}}
(see above in the \LyX{} work area). The ``Multiple Columns'' module
is documented in detail in \textsf{Help\lyxarrow{}Additional Features}.\columnbreak

\begin{tcolorbox}[title=Available Font Sizes (with corresponding \LaTeX\ command),
enhanced, watermark text=Font Sizes]


{\tiny{}Tiny (}\texttt{\tiny{}\textbackslash{}tiny}{\tiny{})}{\tiny \par}

{\scriptsize{}Smallest (}\texttt{\scriptsize{}\textbackslash{}scriptsize}{\scriptsize{})}{\scriptsize \par}

{\footnotesize{}Smaller (}\texttt{\footnotesize{}\textbackslash{}footnotesize}{\footnotesize{})}{\footnotesize \par}

Normal (\texttt{\textbackslash{}normalsize})

{\large{}Large (}\texttt{\large{}\textbackslash{}large}{\large{})}{\large \par}

{\Large{}Larger (}\texttt{\Large{}\textbackslash{}Large}{\Large{})}{\Large \par}

{\LARGE{}Largest (}\texttt{\LARGE{}\textbackslash{}LARGE}{\LARGE{})}{\LARGE \par}

{\huge{}Huge (}\texttt{\huge{}\textbackslash{}huge}{\huge{})}{\huge \par}

{\Huge{}Huger (}\texttt{\Huge{}\textbackslash{}Huge}{\Huge{})}{\Huge \par}

{\veryHuge{}Giant (\texttt{\textbackslash{}veryHuge})\par}

{\VeryHuge{}More Giant (\texttt{\textbackslash{}VeryHuge})\par}

{\VERYHuge{}Most Giant (\texttt{\textbackslash{}VERYHuge})\par}
\end{tcolorbox}


\begin{tcolorbox}[title=Boxes with Two Levels, collower=myboxcolor]


By means of the \textsf{Color Box Separator} paragraph style, a color
box can be split in an upper \ldots{}


\tcblower{}

\ldots{} and a lower part. This can only done once per box. The \textsf{Color
Box Line} paragraph style, which just draws the separation line without
actually separating the box, can be used repeatedly.
\end{tcolorbox}


\begin{center}
\tcbox[title=Look: A Table!, left=0mm, right=0mm, top=0mm, bottom=0mm, boxsep=0mm,
toptitle=5mm, lefttitle=3mm, bottomtitle=5mm]{\arrayrulecolor{myboxcolor}\renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.2}%

\Large%
\begin{tabular}{c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c}
One  & Two  & Three  & Four & Five & Six & Seven & Eight & Nine & Ten & Eleven & Twelve\tabularnewline
\hline 
\hline 
A  & B  & C  & D & E & F & G & H & I & J & K & L\tabularnewline
\hline 
I  & II & III  & IV & V & VI & VII & VIII & IX & X & XI & XII\tabularnewline
\end{tabular}}
\par\end{center}

\begin{tcolorbox}[title=Themes, skin=beamer]


Color boxes can be themed (``skinned'').


\tcblower{}

This is the ``beamer'' skin.
\end{tcolorbox}


\begin{tcolorbox}[title=Tweaking the Boxes, leftrule=13mm, colback=red!5!white, colframe=myboxcolor,
arc=14mm, boxsep=1cm, height=10cm, valign=center, enhanced, interior
style={left color=myboxcolor!10, right color=myboxcolor}, frame
style={right color=myboxcolor!10, left color=myboxcolor}, coltext=white,
fontupper=\Large]
\textcolor{black}{Color box appearance can be customized in many
different ways.}\textsf{\textcolor{white}{\hfill{}}}Please refer
to the \textsf{tcolorbox} manual for details.
\end{tcolorbox}


\vfill{}

\begin{center}
Poster Footer
\par\end{center}
\end{tcolorbox}
